qas.question: What causes the ice to break and crack loudly?
What does the cracking of the ice create?

context: Alpine glaciers can be straight rivers of ice, long sweeping rivers, <a0_0>spread in a fan-like shape<a0_0/> (Piedmont glaciers), and curtains of ice that hang from vertical slopes of the mountain peaks. <a1_0>The stress of the movement<a1_0/> causes the ice to break and crack loudly, perhaps explaining why the mountains were believed to be home to dragons in the medieval period. The cracking creates <a2_0>unpredictable and dangerous crevasses<a2_0/>, often invisible under new snowfall, which cause the greatest danger to mountaineers.
